questions.question: What is the process of converting a Context-Free Grammar (CFG) into a Non-Deterministic Pushdown Automaton (NPDA)?
In the conversion from CFG to NPDA, what type of automaton is an NPDA?
When converting a CFG to an NPDA, which CFG element is simulated by stack operations (e.g., ε-moves that replace a symbol on the stack)?
During NPDA initialization for CFG simulation, what is typically pushed onto the stack first?

answers.b: A bottom marker (Γ) followed by the start variable S

questions.question: Which normal form for CFGs ensures every production begins with a terminal and thus makes direct CFG→NPDA construction straightforward?
Which of the following languages is context-free and can be recognized by an NPDA but cannot be recognized by any finite automaton?

answers.a: The set of all strings over {a,b} ( (a+b)* )
answers.d: The set of all binary strings with an even number of bits
